ygData.subject: Re: Updated: Rangers and Warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: My max damage since obtaining the sword was 21.  I have never hit for more than that even with my skill maxxed.  I max all my weapons skills at every level so
ygData.messageBody:
My max damage since obtaining the sword was 21. I have never hit for more
than that even with my skill maxxed. I max all my weapons skills at every
level so far. Within minutes of reaching level 10 I started hitting for 25.
I am not complaining of course. However, if this is a damage bonus based
on level I am disturbed because we are talking about a ranger not a warrior.

My max damage on my warrior hasn't changed at all up to level 15. Still hit
for a max of 17 with a mino axe, 11 with a combine scimitar and 8 with a
tentacle whip.


-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Auman <jeff.auman@...>
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, May 27, 1999 6:10 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Updated: Rangers and Warriors


>From: Jeff Auman <jeff.auman@...>
>
>> Tom Swift wrote:
>>
>> This might have something to do with the patch this week so I am going
>> to log in as my warrior tonight and experiment.
>>
>> This is the fact. My Fine steel 2 handed sword has a damage of 12 and
>> delay of 43. I normally hit for 21 damage with it. 2 days ago I
>> bought a purity belt boosting my str from 80 to 82. I did not notice
>> any damage change. Last night within minutes of levelling up to 10 I
>> started hitting for max damage of 25.
>>
>> Any one know anything about this?
>
>Interesting, but I think your base assumption might be wrong. The two
>weapons I use had a base damage of 8 and 6. (Mino axe, and tomahawk).
>I had a max damage of 17 and 13 (2xbase + 1) on each respectively.
>If you are hitting for 25, I would think this fits right in line
>with the 2xbase +1 formula.
>
>I am more curious as to why you weren't hitting for max potential
>previously. Were you burdened? Perhaps at only 80 STR you had a
>penalty? Perhaps a bug was fixed and you now are hitting for the
>correct damage. The most likely thing though I can think of is
>was your weapon skill for the 2H slash maxed for your level? When
>I've been practicing recently, I almost never hit for max with my
>2H slash, but it is significantly below max (like 20 out of 95).
>
>Btw, I'm an 18th Barbarian warrior, STR of 120. So perhaps the
>comparison isn't quite fair.
>
>-Jeff
>--
>-Jeff Auman
>jauman@...
>
